title: Clarification of when Go's pointers are dereferenced.
body:
by **danny.gratzer**: 
This is not an issue with a spec, but a potential omission.

I recently asked a question on Stack Overflow and it seemed that their isn't a complete
documentation of when a Go compiler can automatically dereference a pointer.

It is clear the a selector expression will dereference a pointer, but it appears that
Go's compilers also do so with array pointers, see here
(http://play.golang.org/p/rzghw-23jl)

I would expect this to fail to compile based on the spec, but it compiles on every Go
compiler I've tried (play.golang.org, gccgo, and 6go)
